allowaccess.help: Control management access to the managed WTP, FortiAP, or AP. Separate entries with a space.
allowaccess.name: allowaccess

ap-country.help: Country in which this WTP, FortiAP or AP will operate (default = NA, automatically use the country configured for the current VDOM).
ap-country.name: ap-country

ap-handoff.help: Enable/disable AP handoff of clients to other APs (default = disable).
ap-handoff.name: ap-handoff

console-login.help: Enable/disable FAP console login access (default = enable).
console-login.name: console-login

control-message-offload.default: ebp-frame aeroscout-tag ap-list sta-list sta-cap-list stats aeroscout-mu sta-health spectral-analysis
control-message-offload.help: Enable/disable CAPWAP control message data channel offload.
control-message-offload.name: control-message-offload

options.help: WTP, radio, VAP, and STA statistics.
options.name: stats

mac.help: A WiFi device with this MAC address is denied access to this WTP, FortiAP or AP.
mac.name: mac

deny-mac-list.help: List of MAC addresses that are denied access to this WTP, FortiAP, or AP.
deny-mac-list.name: deny-mac-list

dtls-in-kernel.help: Enable/disable data channel DTLS in kernel.
dtls-in-kernel.name: dtls-in-kernel

options.help: Enable data channel DTLS in kernel.
options.name: enable

options.help: Disable data channel DTLS in kernel.
options.name: disable

dtls-policy.help: WTP data channel DTLS policy (default = clear-text).
dtls-policy.name: dtls-policy

energy-efficient-ethernet.help: Enable/disable use of energy efficient Ethernet on WTP.
energy-efficient-ethernet.name: energy-efficient-ethernet

options.help: Enable use of energy efficient Ethernet on WTP.
options.name: enable

options.help: Disable use of energy efficient Ethernet on WTP.
options.name: disable

apc-addr-type.help: ESL SES-imagotag APC address type (default = fqdn).
apc-addr-type.name: apc-addr-type

apc-fqdn.help: FQDN of ESL SES-imagotag Access Point Controller (APC).
apc-fqdn.name: apc-fqdn

apc-ip.help: IP address of ESL SES-imagotag Access Point Controller (APC).
apc-ip.name: apc-ip

apc-port.help: Port of ESL SES-imagotag Access Point Controller (APC).
apc-port.name: apc-port

coex-level.help: ESL SES-imagotag dongle coexistence level (default = none).
coex-level.name: coex-level

options.help: No support for coexistence of USB-Dongle with WiFi AP.
options.name: none

compliance-level.help: Compliance levels for the ESL solution integration (default = compliance-level-2).
compliance-level.name: compliance-level

options.help: Compliance Level 2 - Full Cloud Support, IoT and Fast-Response.
options.name: compliance-level-2

options.help: Managed channel enabled, indicates that the APC (server) is setting the esl-channel via the slot channel

output-power.help: ESL SES-imagotag dongle output power (default = A).
output-power.name: output-power

scd-enable.help: Enable/disable ESL SES-imagotag Serial Communication Daemon (SCD) (default = disable).
scd-enable.name: scd-enable

frequency-handoff.help: Enable/disable frequency handoff of clients to other channels (default = disable).
frequency-handoff.name: frequency-handoff

handoff-roaming.help: Enable/disable client load balancing during roaming to avoid roaming delay (default = disable).
handoff-roaming.name: handoff-roaming

handoff-rssi.help: Minimum received signal strength indicator (RSSI) value for handoff (20 - 30, default = 25).
handoff-rssi.name: handoff-rssi

indoor-outdoor-deployment.help: Set to allow indoor/outdoor-only channels under regulatory rules (default = platform-determined).
indoor-outdoor-deployment.name: indoor-outdoor-deployment

options.help: Set AP deployment type based on its platform.
options.name: platform-determined

options.help: Set AP deployment type to outdoor.
options.name: outdoor

options.help: Set AP deployment type to indoor.
options.name: indoor

ip-fragment-preventing.help: Method(s) by which IP fragmentation is prevented for control and data packets through CAPWAP tunnel (default = tcp-mss-adjust).
ip-fragment-preventing.name: ip-fragment-preventing

options.help: Drop packet and send ICMP Destination Unreachable
options.name: icmp-unreachable

aeroscout.help: Enable/disable AeroScout Real Time Location Service (RTLS) support (default = disable).
aeroscout.name: aeroscout

aeroscout-ap-mac.help: Use BSSID or board MAC address as AP MAC address in AeroScout AP messages (default = bssid).
aeroscout-ap-mac.name: aeroscout-ap-mac

options.help: Use BSSID as AP MAC address in AeroScout AP messages.
options.name: bssid

options.help: Use board MAC address as AP MAC address in AeroScout AP messages.
options.name: board-mac

aeroscout-mmu-report.help: Enable/disable compounded AeroScout tag and MU report (default = enable).
aeroscout-mmu-report.name: aeroscout-mmu-report

options.help: Enable compounded AeroScout tag and MU report.
options.name: enable

options.help: Disable compounded AeroScout tag and MU report.
options.name: disable

aeroscout-mu.help: Enable/disable AeroScout Mobile Unit (MU) support (default = disable).
aeroscout-mu.name: aeroscout-mu

aeroscout-mu-timeout.help: AeroScout MU mode timeout (0 - 65535 sec, default = 5).
aeroscout-mu-timeout.name: aeroscout-mu-timeout

ekahau-blink-mode.help: Enable/disable Ekahau blink mode (now known as AiRISTA Flow) to track and locate WiFi tags (default = disable).
ekahau-blink-mode.name: ekahau-blink-mode

ekahau-tag.help: WiFi frame MAC address or WiFi Tag.
ekahau-tag.name: ekahau-tag

erc-server-ip.help: IP address of Ekahau RTLS Controller (ERC).
erc-server-ip.name: erc-server-ip

erc-server-port.help: Ekahau RTLS Controller (ERC) UDP listening port.
erc-server-port.name: erc-server-port

fortipresence.help: Enable/disable FortiPresence to monitor the location and activity of WiFi clients even if they don't connect to this WiFi network (default = disable).
fortipresence.name: fortipresence

options.help: FortiPresence monitors foreign channels only. Foreign channels mean all other available channels than the current operating channel of the WTP, AP, or FortiAP.
options.name: foreign

options.help: Enable FortiPresence on both foreign and home channels. Select this option to have FortiPresence monitor all WiFi channels.
options.name: both

fortipresence-ble.help: Enable/disable FortiPresence finding and reporting BLE devices.
fortipresence-ble.name: fortipresence-ble

options.help: Enable FortiPresence finding and reporting BLE devices.
options.name: enable

options.help: Disable FortiPresence finding and reporting BLE devices.
options.name: disable

fortipresence-frequency.help: FortiPresence report transmit frequency (5 - 65535 sec, default = 30).
fortipresence-frequency.name: fortipresence-frequency

fortipresence-port.help: UDP listening port of FortiPresence server (default = 3000).
fortipresence-port.name: fortipresence-port

fortipresence-project.help: FortiPresence project name (max. 16 characters, default = fortipresence).
fortipresence-project.name: fortipresence-project

fortipresence-rogue.help: Enable/disable FortiPresence finding and reporting rogue APs.
fortipresence-rogue.name: fortipresence-rogue

options.help: Enable FortiPresence finding and reporting rogue APs.
options.name: enable

options.help: Disable FortiPresence finding and reporting rogue APs.
options.name: disable

fortipresence-unassoc.help: Enable/disable FortiPresence finding and reporting unassociated stations.
fortipresence-unassoc.name: fortipresence-unassoc

options.help: Enable FortiPresence finding and reporting unassociated stations.
options.name: enable

options.help: Disable FortiPresence finding and reporting unassociated stations.
options.name: disable

station-locate.help: Enable/disable client station locating services for all clients, whether associated or not (default = disable).
station-locate.name: station-locate

lbs.help: Set various location based service (LBS) options.
lbs.name: lbs

led-schedules.help: Recurring firewall schedules for illuminating LEDs on the FortiAP. If led-state is enabled, LEDs will be visible when at least one of the schedules is valid. Separate multiple schedule names with a space.
led-schedules.name: led-schedules

led-state.help: Enable/disable use of LEDs on WTP (default = disable).
led-state.name: led-state

options.help: Enable use of LEDs on WTP.
options.name: enable

options.help: Disable use of LEDs on WTP.
options.name: disable

lldp.help: Enable/disable Link Layer Discovery Protocol (LLDP) for the WTP, FortiAP, or AP (default = enable).
lldp.name: lldp

login-passwd.help: Set the managed WTP, FortiAP, or AP's administrator password.
login-passwd.name: login-passwd

login-passwd-change.help: Change or reset the administrator password of a managed WTP, FortiAP or AP (yes, default, or no, default = no).
login-passwd-change.name: login-passwd-change

options.help: Change the managed WTP, FortiAP or AP's administrator password. Use the login-password option to set the password.
options.name: yes

options.help: Keep the managed WTP, FortiAP or AP's administrator password set to the factory default.
options.name: default

options.help: Do not change the managed WTP, FortiAP or AP's administrator password.
options.name: no

max-clients.help: Maximum number of stations (STAs) supported by the WTP (default = 0, meaning no client limitation).
max-clients.name: max-clients

name.help: WTP (or FortiAP or AP) profile name.
name.name: name

ddscan.help: Enable/disable use of one radio for dedicated dual-band scanning to detect RF characterization and wireless threat management.
ddscan.name: ddscan

mode.help: Configure operation mode of 5G radios (default = single-5G).
mode.name: mode

options.help: Configure radios as one 5GHz band, one 2.4GHz band, and one dedicated monitor or sniffer.
options.name: single-5G

options.help: Configure radios as one lower 5GHz band, one higher 5GHz band and one 2.4GHz band respectively.
options.name: dual-5G

type.help: WTP, FortiAP or AP platform type. There are built-in WTP profiles for all supported FortiAP models. You can select a built-in profile and customize it or create a new profile.
type.name: type

poe-mode.help: Set the WTP, FortiAP, or AP's PoE mode.
poe-mode.name: poe-mode

options.help: Use the power adapter to control the PoE mode.
options.name: power-adapter

amsdu.help: Enable/disable 802.11n AMSDU support. AMSDU can improve performance if supported by your WiFi clients (default = enable).
amsdu.name: amsdu

ap-handoff.help: Enable/disable AP handoff of clients to other APs (default = disable).
ap-handoff.name: ap-handoff

ap-sniffer-chan.help: Channel on which to operate the sniffer (default = 6).
ap-sniffer-chan.name: ap-sniffer-chan

ap-sniffer-ctl.help: Enable/disable sniffer on WiFi control frame (default = enable).
ap-sniffer-ctl.name: ap-sniffer-ctl

options.help: Enable sniffer on WiFi control frame.
options.name: enable

options.help: Disable sniffer on WiFi control frame.
options.name: disable

ap-sniffer-data.help: Enable/disable sniffer on WiFi data frame (default = enable).
ap-sniffer-data.name: ap-sniffer-data

options.help: Enable sniffer on WiFi data frame
options.name: enable

options.help: Disable sniffer on WiFi data frame
options.name: disable

ap-sniffer-mgmt-beacon.help: Enable/disable sniffer on WiFi management Beacon frames (default = enable).
ap-sniffer-mgmt-beacon.name: ap-sniffer-mgmt-beacon

options.help: Enable sniffer on WiFi management beacon frame.
options.name: enable

options.help: Disable sniffer on WiFi management beacon frame.
options.name: disable

ap-sniffer-mgmt-other.help: Enable/disable sniffer on WiFi management other frames  (default = enable).
ap-sniffer-mgmt-other.name: ap-sniffer-mgmt-other

options.help: Enable sniffer on WiFi management other frame.
options.name: enable

options.help: Disable sniffer on WiFi management other frame.
options.name: disable

ap-sniffer-mgmt-probe.help: Enable/disable sniffer on WiFi management probe frames (default = enable).
ap-sniffer-mgmt-probe.name: ap-sniffer-mgmt-probe

options.help: Enable sniffer on WiFi management probe frame.
options.name: enable

options.help: Enable sniffer on WiFi management probe frame.
options.name: disable

auto-power-high.help: The upper bound of automatic transmit power adjustment in dBm (the actual range of transmit power depends on the AP platform type).
auto-power-high.name: auto-power-high

auto-power-level.help: Enable/disable automatic power-level adjustment to prevent co-channel interference (default = enable).
auto-power-level.name: auto-power-level

auto-power-low.help: The lower bound of automatic transmit power adjustment in dBm (the actual range of transmit power depends on the AP platform type).
auto-power-low.name: auto-power-low

auto-power-target.help: The target of automatic transmit power adjustment in dBm. (-95 to -20, default = -70).
auto-power-target.name: auto-power-target

band.help: WiFi band that Radio 1 operates on.
band.name: band

bandwidth-admission-control.help: Enable/disable WiFi multimedia (WMM) bandwidth admission control to optimize WiFi bandwidth use. A request to join the wireless network is only allowed if the access point has enough bandwidth to support it.
bandwidth-admission-control.name: bandwidth-admission-control

bandwidth-capacity.help: Maximum bandwidth capacity allowed (1 - 600000 Kbps, default = 2000).
bandwidth-capacity.name: bandwidth-capacity

beacon-interval.help: Beacon interval. The time between beacon frames in msec (the actual range of beacon interval depends on the AP platform type, default = 100).
beacon-interval.name: beacon-interval

bss-color.help: BSS color value for this 11ax radio (0 - 63, 0 means disable. default = 0).
bss-color.name: bss-color

bss-color-mode.help: BSS color mode for this 11ax radio (default = auto).
bss-color-mode.name: bss-color-mode

options.help: Automatically select BSS color value on AP.
options.name: auto

options.help: Set BSS color value on this radio based on 'bss-color' CLI.
options.name: static

call-admission-control.help: Enable/disable WiFi multimedia (WMM) call admission control to optimize WiFi bandwidth use for VoIP calls. New VoIP calls are only accepted if there is enough bandwidth available to support them.
call-admission-control.name: call-admission-control

call-capacity.help: Maximum number of Voice over WLAN (VoWLAN) phones supported by the radio (0 - 60, default = 10).
call-capacity.name: call-capacity

channel.help: Selected list of wireless radio channels.
channel.name: channel

channel-bonding.help: Channel bandwidth: 160,80, 40, or 20MHz. Channels may use both 20 and 40 by enabling coexistence.
channel-bonding.name: channel-bonding

coexistence.help: Enable/disable allowing both HT20 and HT40 on the same radio (default = enable).
coexistence.name: coexistence

options.help: Enable support for both HT20 and HT40 on the same radio.
options.name: enable

options.help: Disable support for both HT20 and HT40 on the same radio.
options.name: disable

darrp.help: Enable/disable Distributed Automatic Radio Resource Provisioning (DARRP) to make sure the radio is always using the most optimal channel (default = disable).
darrp.name: darrp

options.help: Enable distributed automatic radio resource provisioning.
options.name: enable

options.help: Disable distributed automatic radio resource provisioning.
options.name: disable

drma.help: Enable/disable dynamic radio mode assignment (DRMA) (default = disable).
drma.name: drma

drma-sensitivity.help: Network Coverage Factor (NCF) percentage required to consider a radio as redundant (default = low).
drma-sensitivity.name: drma-sensitivity

options.help: Consider a radio as redundant when its NCF is 100%.
options.name: low

options.help: Consider a radio as redundant when its NCF is 95%.
options.name: medium

options.help: Consider a radio as redundant when its NCF is 90%.
options.name: high

dtim.help: Delivery Traffic Indication Map (DTIM) period (1 - 255, default = 1). Set higher to save battery life of WiFi client in power-save mode.
dtim.name: dtim

frag-threshold.help: Maximum packet size that can be sent without fragmentation (800 - 2346 bytes, default = 2346).
frag-threshold.name: frag-threshold

frequency-handoff.help: Enable/disable frequency handoff of clients to other channels (default = disable).
frequency-handoff.name: frequency-handoff

max-clients.help: Maximum number of stations (STAs) or WiFi clients supported by the radio. Range depends on the hardware.
max-clients.name: max-clients

max-distance.help: Maximum expected distance between the AP and clients (0 - 54000 m, default = 0).
max-distance.name: max-distance

mode.help: Mode of radio 1. Radio 1 can be disabled, configured as an access point, a rogue AP monitor, a sniffer, or a station.
mode.name: mode

options.help: Radio 1 operates as an access point that allows WiFi clients to connect to your network.
options.name: ap

options.help: Radio 1 operates as a dedicated monitor. As a monitor, the radio scans for other WiFi access points and adds them to the Rogue AP monitor list.
options.name: monitor

options.help: Radio 1 operates as a sniffer capturing WiFi frames on air.
options.name: sniffer

options.help: Radio 1 operates as a station that can connect to a neighboring AP for connectivity and health check.
options.name: sam

power-level.help: Radio EIRP power level as a percentage of the maximum EIRP power (0 - 100, default = 100).
power-level.name: power-level

power-mode.help: Set radio effective isotropic radiated power (EIRP) in dBm or by a percentage of the maximum EIRP (default = percentage). This power takes into account both radio transmit power and antenna gain. Higher power level settings may be constrained by local regulatory requirements and AP capabilities.
power-mode.name: power-mode

options.help: Set radio EIRP power in dBm.
options.name: dBm

options.help: Set radio EIRP power by percentage.
options.name: percentage

power-value.help: Radio EIRP power in dBm (1 - 33, default = 27).
power-value.name: power-value

powersave-optimize.help: Enable client power-saving features such as TIM, AC VO, and OBSS etc.
powersave-optimize.name: powersave-optimize

options.help: TIM bit for client in power save mode.
options.name: tim

options.help: Use AC VO priority to send out packets in the power save queue.
options.name: ac-vo

options.help: Do not put OBSS scan IE into beacon and probe response frames.
options.name: no-obss-scan

options.help: Do not send frame using 11b data rate.
options.name: no-11b-rate

options.help: Adapt transmitting PHY rate with receiving PHY rate from a client.
options.name: client-rate-follow

protection-mode.help: Enable/disable 802.11g protection modes to support backwards compatibility with older clients (rtscts, ctsonly, disable).
protection-mode.name: protection-mode

rts-threshold.help: Maximum packet size for RTS transmissions, specifying the maximum size of a data packet before RTS/CTS (256 - 2346 bytes, default = 2346).
rts-threshold.name: rts-threshold

sam-cwp-failure-string.help: Failure identification on the page after an incorrect login.
sam-cwp-failure-string.name: sam-cwp-failure-string

sam-cwp-match-string.help: Identification string from the captive portal login form.
sam-cwp-match-string.name: sam-cwp-match-string

sam-cwp-success-string.help: Success identification on the page after a successful login.
sam-cwp-success-string.name: sam-cwp-success-string

sam-cwp-test-url.help: Website the client is trying to access.
sam-cwp-test-url.name: sam-cwp-test-url

sam-report-intv.help: SAM report interval (sec), 0 for a one-time report.
sam-report-intv.name: sam-report-intv

sam-server.help: SAM test server IP address or domain name.
sam-server.name: sam-server

short-guard-interval.help: Use either the short guard interval (Short GI) of 400 ns or the long guard interval (Long GI) of 800 ns.
short-guard-interval.name: short-guard-interval

options.help: Select the 400 ns short guard interval (Short GI).
options.name: enable

options.help: Select the 800 ns long guard interval (Long GI).
options.name: disable

spectrum-analysis.help: Enable/disable spectrum analysis to find interference that would negatively impact wireless performance.
spectrum-analysis.name: spectrum-analysis

transmit-optimize.help: Packet transmission optimization options including power saving, aggregation limiting, retry limiting, etc. All are enabled by default.
transmit-optimize.name: transmit-optimize

options.help: Tag client as operating in power save mode if excessive transmit retries occur.
options.name: power-save

options.help: Set aggregation limit to a lower value when data rate is low.
options.name: aggr-limit

options.help: Set software retry limit to a lower value when data rate is low.
options.name: retry-limit

vap-all.help: Configure method for assigning SSIDs to this FortiAP (default = automatically assign tunnel SSIDs).
vap-all.name: vap-all

vaps.help: Manually selected list of Virtual Access Points (VAPs).
vaps.name: vaps

wids-profile.help: Wireless Intrusion Detection System (WIDS) profile name to assign to the radio.
wids-profile.name: wids-profile

zero-wait-dfs.help: Enable/disable zero wait DFS on radio (default = enable).
zero-wait-dfs.name: zero-wait-dfs

amsdu.help: Enable/disable 802.11n AMSDU support. AMSDU can improve performance if supported by your WiFi clients (default = enable).
amsdu.name: amsdu

ap-handoff.help: Enable/disable AP handoff of clients to other APs (default = disable).
ap-handoff.name: ap-handoff

ap-sniffer-chan.help: Channel on which to operate the sniffer (default = 6).
ap-sniffer-chan.name: ap-sniffer-chan

ap-sniffer-ctl.help: Enable/disable sniffer on WiFi control frame (default = enable).
ap-sniffer-ctl.name: ap-sniffer-ctl

options.help: Enable sniffer on WiFi control frame.
options.name: enable

options.help: Disable sniffer on WiFi control frame.
options.name: disable

ap-sniffer-data.help: Enable/disable sniffer on WiFi data frame (default = enable).
ap-sniffer-data.name: ap-sniffer-data

options.help: Enable sniffer on WiFi data frame
options.name: enable

options.help: Disable sniffer on WiFi data frame
options.name: disable

ap-sniffer-mgmt-beacon.help: Enable/disable sniffer on WiFi management Beacon frames (default = enable).
ap-sniffer-mgmt-beacon.name: ap-sniffer-mgmt-beacon

options.help: Enable sniffer on WiFi management beacon frame.
options.name: enable

options.help: Disable sniffer on WiFi management beacon frame.
options.name: disable

ap-sniffer-mgmt-other.help: Enable/disable sniffer on WiFi management other frames  (default = enable).
ap-sniffer-mgmt-other.name: ap-sniffer-mgmt-other

options.help: Enable sniffer on WiFi management other frame.
options.name: enable

options.help: Disable sniffer on WiFi management other frame.
options.name: disable

ap-sniffer-mgmt-probe.help: Enable/disable sniffer on WiFi management probe frames (default = enable).
ap-sniffer-mgmt-probe.name: ap-sniffer-mgmt-probe

options.help: Enable sniffer on WiFi management probe frame.
options.name: enable

options.help: Enable sniffer on WiFi management probe frame.
options.name: disable

auto-power-high.help: The upper bound of automatic transmit power adjustment in dBm (the actual range of transmit power depends on the AP platform type).
auto-power-high.name: auto-power-high

auto-power-level.help: Enable/disable automatic power-level adjustment to prevent co-channel interference (default = enable).
auto-power-level.name: auto-power-level

auto-power-low.help: The lower bound of automatic transmit power adjustment in dBm (the actual range of transmit power depends on the AP platform type).
auto-power-low.name: auto-power-low

auto-power-target.help: The target of automatic transmit power adjustment in dBm. (-95 to -20, default = -70).
auto-power-target.name: auto-power-target

band.help: WiFi band that Radio 2 operates on.
band.name: band

bandwidth-admission-control.help: Enable/disable WiFi multimedia (WMM) bandwidth admission control to optimize WiFi bandwidth use. A request to join the wireless network is only allowed if the access point has enough bandwidth to support it.
bandwidth-admission-control.name: bandwidth-admission-control

bandwidth-capacity.help: Maximum bandwidth capacity allowed (1 - 600000 Kbps, default = 2000).
bandwidth-capacity.name: bandwidth-capacity

beacon-interval.help: Beacon interval. The time between beacon frames in msec (the actual range of beacon interval depends on the AP platform type, default = 100).
beacon-interval.name: beacon-interval

bss-color.help: BSS color value for this 11ax radio (0 - 63, 0 means disable. default = 0).
bss-color.name: bss-color

bss-color-mode.help: BSS color mode for this 11ax radio (default = auto).
bss-color-mode.name: bss-color-mode

options.help: Automatically select BSS color value on AP.
options.name: auto

options.help: Set BSS color value on this radio based on 'bss-color' CLI.
options.name: static

call-admission-control.help: Enable/disable WiFi multimedia (WMM) call admission control to optimize WiFi bandwidth use for VoIP calls. New VoIP calls are only accepted if there is enough bandwidth available to support them.
call-admission-control.name: call-admission-control

call-capacity.help: Maximum number of Voice over WLAN (VoWLAN) phones supported by the radio (0 - 60, default = 10).
call-capacity.name: call-capacity

channel.help: Selected list of wireless radio channels.
channel.name: channel

channel-bonding.help: Channel bandwidth: 160,80, 40, or 20MHz. Channels may use both 20 and 40 by enabling coexistence.
channel-bonding.name: channel-bonding

coexistence.help: Enable/disable allowing both HT20 and HT40 on the same radio (default = enable).
coexistence.name: coexistence

options.help: Enable support for both HT20 and HT40 on the same radio.
options.name: enable

options.help: Disable support for both HT20 and HT40 on the same radio.
options.name: disable

darrp.help: Enable/disable Distributed Automatic Radio Resource Provisioning (DARRP) to make sure the radio is always using the most optimal channel (default = disable).
darrp.name: darrp

options.help: Enable distributed automatic radio resource provisioning.
options.name: enable

options.help: Disable distributed automatic radio resource provisioning.
options.name: disable

drma.help: Enable/disable dynamic radio mode assignment (DRMA) (default = disable).
drma.name: drma

drma-sensitivity.help: Network Coverage Factor (NCF) percentage required to consider a radio as redundant (default = low).
drma-sensitivity.name: drma-sensitivity

options.help: Consider a radio as redundant when its NCF is 100%.
options.name: low

options.help: Consider a radio as redundant when its NCF is 95%.
options.name: medium

options.help: Consider a radio as redundant when its NCF is 90%.
options.name: high

dtim.help: Delivery Traffic Indication Map (DTIM) period (1 - 255, default = 1). Set higher to save battery life of WiFi client in power-save mode.
dtim.name: dtim

frag-threshold.help: Maximum packet size that can be sent without fragmentation (800 - 2346 bytes, default = 2346).
frag-threshold.name: frag-threshold

frequency-handoff.help: Enable/disable frequency handoff of clients to other channels (default = disable).
frequency-handoff.name: frequency-handoff

max-clients.help: Maximum number of stations (STAs) or WiFi clients supported by the radio. Range depends on the hardware.
max-clients.name: max-clients

max-distance.help: Maximum expected distance between the AP and clients (0 - 54000 m, default = 0).
max-distance.name: max-distance

mode.help: Mode of radio 2. Radio 2 can be disabled, configured as an access point, a rogue AP monitor, a sniffer, or a station.
mode.name: mode

options.help: Radio 2 operates as an access point that allows WiFi clients to connect to your network.
options.name: ap

options.help: Radio 2 operates as a dedicated monitor. As a monitor, the radio scans for other WiFi access points and adds them to the Rogue AP monitor list.
options.name: monitor

options.help: Radio 2 operates as a sniffer capturing WiFi frames on air.
options.name: sniffer

options.help: Radio 2 operates as a station that can connect to a neighboring AP for connectivity and health check.
options.name: sam

power-level.help: Radio EIRP power level as a percentage of the maximum EIRP power (0 - 100, default = 100).
power-level.name: power-level

power-mode.help: Set radio effective isotropic radiated power (EIRP) in dBm or by a percentage of the maximum EIRP (default = percentage). This power takes into account both radio transmit power and antenna gain. Higher power level settings may be constrained by local regulatory requirements and AP capabilities.
power-mode.name: power-mode

options.help: Set radio EIRP power in dBm.
options.name: dBm

options.help: Set radio EIRP power by percentage.
options.name: percentage

power-value.help: Radio EIRP power in dBm (1 - 33, default = 27).
power-value.name: power-value

powersave-optimize.help: Enable client power-saving features such as TIM, AC VO, and OBSS etc.
powersave-optimize.name: powersave-optimize

options.help: TIM bit for client in power save mode.
options.name: tim

options.help: Use AC VO priority to send out packets in the power save queue.
options.name: ac-vo

options.help: Do not put OBSS scan IE into beacon and probe response frames.
options.name: no-obss-scan

options.help: Do not send frame using 11b data rate.
options.name: no-11b-rate

options.help: Adapt transmitting PHY rate with receiving PHY rate from a client.
options.name: client-rate-follow

protection-mode.help: Enable/disable 802.11g protection modes to support backwards compatibility with older clients (rtscts, ctsonly, disable).
protection-mode.name: protection-mode

rts-threshold.help: Maximum packet size for RTS transmissions, specifying the maximum size of a data packet before RTS/CTS (256 - 2346 bytes, default = 2346).
rts-threshold.name: rts-threshold

sam-cwp-failure-string.help: Failure identification on the page after an incorrect login.
sam-cwp-failure-string.name: sam-cwp-failure-string

sam-cwp-match-string.help: Identification string from the captive portal login form.
sam-cwp-match-string.name: sam-cwp-match-string

sam-cwp-success-string.help: Success identification on the page after a successful login.
sam-cwp-success-string.name: sam-cwp-success-string

sam-cwp-test-url.help: Website the client is trying to access.
sam-cwp-test-url.name: sam-cwp-test-url

sam-report-intv.help: SAM report interval (sec), 0 for a one-time report.
sam-report-intv.name: sam-report-intv

sam-server.help: SAM test server IP address or domain name.
sam-server.name: sam-server

short-guard-interval.help: Use either the short guard interval (Short GI) of 400 ns or the long guard interval (Long GI) of 800 ns.
short-guard-interval.name: short-guard-interval

options.help: Select the 400 ns short guard interval (Short GI).
options.name: enable

options.help: Select the 800 ns long guard interval (Long GI).
options.name: disable

spectrum-analysis.help: Enable/disable spectrum analysis to find interference that would negatively impact wireless performance.
spectrum-analysis.name: spectrum-analysis

transmit-optimize.help: Packet transmission optimization options including power saving, aggregation limiting, retry limiting, etc. All are enabled by default.
transmit-optimize.name: transmit-optimize

options.help: Tag client as operating in power save mode if excessive transmit retries occur.
options.name: power-save

options.help: Set aggregation limit to a lower value when data rate is low.
options.name: aggr-limit

options.help: Set software retry limit to a lower value when data rate is low.
options.name: retry-limit

vap-all.name: vap-all

vaps.help: Manually selected list of Virtual Access Points (VAPs).
vaps.name: vaps

wids-profile.help: Wireless Intrusion Detection System (WIDS) profile name to assign to the radio.
wids-profile.name: wids-profile

zero-wait-dfs.help: Enable/disable zero wait DFS on radio (default = enable).
zero-wait-dfs.name: zero-wait-dfs

amsdu.help: Enable/disable 802.11n AMSDU support. AMSDU can improve performance if supported by your WiFi clients (default = enable).
amsdu.name: amsdu

ap-handoff.help: Enable/disable AP handoff of clients to other APs (default = disable).

options.help: Select the 800 ns long guard interval (Long GI).
options.name: disable

spectrum-analysis.help: Enable/disable spectrum analysis to find interference that would negatively impact wireless performance.
spectrum-analysis.name: spectrum-analysis

transmit-optimize.help: Packet transmission optimization options including power saving, aggregation limiting, retry limiting, etc. All are enabled by default.
transmit-optimize.name: transmit-optimize

options.help: Tag client as operating in power save mode if excessive transmit retries occur.
options.name: power-save

options.help: Set aggregation limit to a lower value when data rate is low.
options.name: aggr-limit

options.help: Set software retry limit to a lower value when data rate is low.
options.name: retry-limit

vap-all.help: Configure method for assigning SSIDs to this FortiAP (default = automatically assign tunnel SSIDs).
vap-all.name: vap-all

vaps.help: Manually selected list of Virtual Access Points (VAPs).
vaps.name: vaps

wids-profile.help: Wireless Intrusion Detection System (WIDS) profile name to assign to the radio.
wids-profile.name: wids-profile

zero-wait-dfs.help: Enable/disable zero wait DFS on radio (default = enable).
zero-wait-dfs.name: zero-wait-dfs

dest-ip.help: Destination IP and mask for the split-tunneling subnet.
dest-ip.name: dest-ip

split-tunneling-acl-local-ap-subnet.help: Enable/disable automatically adding local subnetwork of FortiAP to split-tunneling ACL (default = disable).
split-tunneling-acl-local-ap-subnet.name: split-tunneling-acl-local-ap-subnet

options.help: Enable automatically adding local subnetwork of FortiAP to split-tunneling ACL.
options.name: enable

options.help: Disable automatically adding local subnetwork of FortiAP to split-tunneling ACL.
options.name: disable

split-tunneling-acl-path.help: Split tunneling ACL path is local/tunnel.
split-tunneling-acl-path.name: split-tunneling-acl-path

options.help: Split tunneling ACL list traffic will be tunnel.
options.name: tunnel

options.help: Split tunneling ACL list traffic will be local NATed.
options.name: local

syslog-profile.help: System log server configuration profile name.
syslog-profile.name: syslog-profile

tun-mtu-downlink.help: The MTU of downlink CAPWAP tunnel (576 - 1500 bytes or 0; 0 means the local MTU of FortiAP; default = 0).
tun-mtu-downlink.name: tun-mtu-downlink

tun-mtu-uplink.help: The maximum transmission unit (MTU) of uplink CAPWAP tunnel (576 - 1500 bytes or 0; 0 means the local MTU of FortiAP; default = 0).
tun-mtu-uplink.name: tun-mtu-uplink

wan-port-auth.help: Set WAN port authentication mode (default = none).
wan-port-auth.name: wan-port-auth

wan-port-auth-methods.help: WAN port 802.1x supplicant EAP methods (default = all).
wan-port-auth-methods.name: wan-port-auth-methods

options.help: Do not specify any EAP methods.
options.name: all

wan-port-auth-usrname.help: Set WAN port 802.1x supplicant user name.
wan-port-auth-usrname.name: wan-port-auth-usrname

wan-port-mode.help: Enable/disable using a WAN port as a LAN port.
wan-port-mode.name: wan-port-mode

options.help: Enable using a WAN port as a LAN port.
options.name: wan-lan

options.help: Disable using a WAN port as a LAN port.
options.name: wan-only

results.help: Configure WTP profiles or FortiAP profiles that define radio settings for manageable FortiAP platforms.
results.name: wtp-profile
